intro: Schaefferia ephedroides, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Schaefferia ephedroides is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
